mil3.4.8:0.1_0: The Simile of the Making Hand
mil3.4.8:1.4_0: “Sir, how does the cessation of existence happen?”
mil3.4.8:1.5_0: “Great king, the foolish and incompetent fools are self. They look down on attachment to rebirth, old age, and death, to sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress. They are not freed from suffering, I say.
mil3.4.8:1.6_0: An educated noble disciple doesn’t approve of this, welcome, or keep clinging to them, that mass of suffering ceases. When craving ceases, continued existence ceases. When rebirth ceases, old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress cease.”
